intro: Ilex uraiensis var. formosae, commonly known as the Formosan holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
